chargeHist.descr: Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity
Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan D. Cevan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan D. Cevan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan D. Cevan was found guilty of Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
No contact with minors without agents approval.

Any internet use by him is to be approved by the agent. This may allow him to use the internet for employment. 
Comply with Sex Offender Registry.
Comply with any Sex Offender assessment and treatment recommendations by the agent. 
Comply with any other assessment, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS and DOC. 
Sign release of information forms for the offenders assessment, medication, pharmacy and other treatment that agent requires to monitor compliance with supervision.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.  Set up a plan to have that done before he is discharched.
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment or schooling or combination of both to equal fulltime.
Provide DNA sample if it has not already been completed.
Bond is to be applied with the overpayment being returned to the defendant.

timeConds.notes:
1 day jail credit to be applied to the conditional jail time.
Allowed to serve half on electronic monitoring program.  Must qualify for that program thru an assessment done by the jail. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Sentence to commence within 60 days. Must report today for start date and time.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Ryan D. Cevan in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:31 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Parties address additions/corrections at this time. 

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
54 months prison with 30 months initial confinement followed by 24 months extended supervision - STAYED -
Not eligible for Earned Release or Challenge Incarceration Programs.
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years: 
No contact with minors without agents approval. 
Any internet use by him is to be approved by the agent. This may allow him to use the internet for employment. 
Comply with Sex Offender Registry.
Comply with any Sex Offender assessment and treatment recommendations by the agent. 
Comply with any other assessment, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS and DOC. 
Sign release of information forms for the offenders assessment, medication, pharmacy and other treatment that agent requires to monitor compliance with supervision.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.  Set up a plan to have that done before he is dischar
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment or schooling or combination of both to equal fulltime.
Provide DNA sample if it has not already been completed.
Pay fine of $500 plus costs plus the DNA surcharge. 
Serve 1 year jail.
1 day jail credit to be applied to the conditional jail time.
Allowed to serve half on electronic monitoring program.  Must qualify for that program thru an assessment done by the jail. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time.

Atty Schmidt asks that the bond be returned to the defendant after applying to the fines/costs and surcharges.  Any overpayment is to be returned to the poster. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond is to be applied with the overpayment being returned to the defendant.

8:31 AM Court calls case. Clerk is A.Z
Atty Molepske states appearances.

All 12 jurors have appeared.
Neither party has anything to discuss at this time.

8:32 AM Jurors enter the courtroom.

Court is back on the record for this matter.
All 12 jurors have returned.
Jury had a brief period to deliberate yesterday, will continue deliberation today.
Court advises Jurors if they need something, to communicate through notes.  
Court continues to address Jurors.

8:33 AM Jurors are excused to jury room to continue deliberations.
Jurors have left the courtroom. Court is in recess until there is a verdict or a question.

9:37 AM  Court is back on the record.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Court has been informed that the Jury does have a verdict.
Neither party has anything to put on the record before the Jury return.

9:38 AM Jurors return to the courtroom.

9:39 AM All 12 jurors have returned to the courtroom.

Foreperson hands the verdict forms to the Bailiff, who hands to the Court.

Court reviews the verdict forms.

Court reads the verdict form.

BY THE COURT:
Jury find the Defendant GUILTY of Count 1.

Atty Schmidt requests each juror to be polled.
Court questions each juror.

9:42 AM Court thanks and excuses the jurors.
Court addresses the jurors.

9:43 AM Jurors are free to go.

State requests for judgment on the verdict.
Atty Schmidt moves for jdugment notwithstanding for the verdict.

BY THE COURT:
Court enters judgment on the verdict.
Court orders judgment of conviction be entered on this date.

Parties request a PSI.
Results to be provided to parties at least one week prior to sentencing hearing.
Parties to go to Branch 1 to set a sentencing date.

9:44 AM Court is adjourned.

9:45 AM Court is back on the record.
Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding bond.

Atty Molepske requests bond be revoked for reasons stated on the record.
Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, requests Court to continue the bond for reasons stated on the record.

Court takes a moment to review the bond, reads the bond for the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not modify the bond at this time.

9:49 AM Court is in recess.

8:36 a.m. Defendant Ryan D. Cevan in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin and Detective Travis Morgan is present.

8:38 a.m. All 13 Jurors are returned to the Courtroom.  DA Molepske call witness, Detective Jennifer Holz, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
9:04 a.m. Exhibit P#22 is marked and referred to during direct exam of witness.
and Exhibit P#11 CD is played 0:000 - :007 secs. DA Molepski requests to futher play the CD and provide transcript of recording to the Jurors. No objections. 
9:06 a.m. DA Molepske requests to Publish Exhibit P#22 a transcript of recording of Exhibit P#11 (CD recording). Played 0:000 to 5 mins 47 secs.
9:20 a.m. Exhibits 18, 19, 20 are referred to during direct exam. DA Molepski request Exhibits 11 thru 22 be admitted. BTC: Exhibits 11, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, and  22  are admitted. (P#12 is not marked yet).
9:25 a.m. Cross exam by Atty Schmidt.
9:30 a.m. Court in recess for 5 mins. Jurors returned to jury room.
Exhibit P#12 CD is marked prior to return of Jurors. 
9:38 a.m. Jurors are returned to the courtroom.
9:40 a.m. DA Molepske calls witness, Detective Travis Morgan, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam. Exhibits P#23 and P#24 is marked and referred to during direct exam.
9:58 a.m. Exhibit P#25 is marked and referred to during direct exam. Exhibits 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 16, 18, 19, & 20 are referred to during direct exam.
10:18 a.m. Brief side bar.

10:27 a.m. Objections stated by Atty Schmidt.
10:35 a.m. Court states on the record which evidence items will be allowed to be used as exhibits.

11:02 a.m. Exhibit P#12 is play for the Jurors CD start 12:46:01 pm to 1:00:22 pm and start again at 1:05:56 pm. to 1:09:05 pm.  Start again at 1:09:53 pm to 1:42:43 pm.  Start again at 1:45:28 pm. to 1:49:45 pm.  Start again at 1:51:00 pm to 1:51:47 pm.
Start again at 1:51:47 pm to 1:53:02 pm.  Start again at 1:59:56 pm to 2:03:33 pm
Start again at 2:04:00 pm to 2:05:01 pm.
12:12 pm DA Molepske continues with direct exam. DA requests Exhibits 11, 12, 22, 23, 24, 25 ,26, 28, 29, 30 be admitted. BTC: They are admitted but not exhibit 27 which is taken back to the Sheriffs evidence storage.

1:17 PM Court calls case.
Case continues the second day of the trial.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

State intends to re-call two witnesses briefly.
Court questions for what reasons.
Atty Molepske explains. 
Court questions for further clarifications.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies witnesses being re-called.

State rests.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, his client does not wish to testify. 
Defense moves to rest.

Court reviews the colloquy with Defendant regarding waiving his right to testify.
Defendant understands.

Court finds Defendant knowingly and intelligently wavies his right to testify.

1:24 PM All 13 jurors have returned to the courtroom.

State intends to rest at this  time.

Defense rests as well.  

Testimony is concluded at this time.

1:26 PM Jurors return to jury room for parties to finalize jury instructions.

Court has met with counsel regarding jury instructions yesterday and briefly this morning.  Court reviews the meeting, for the record, regarding the language discussed and intent.

Both counsel concur with the Courts review of the discussions.

Court addresses:
 Jury Instruction 175, will not be used. Both counsel concur.

Jury Instruction 300,  one paragraph taken out. Both counsel concur.

Jury Instruction 200, State believes it is helpful. Atty Schmidt does not object. 
Court will strike sentence referred to.

Jury Instruction 205, will be removed. Both counsel concur.

Jury Instruction 201, will be removed. Both counsel concur.

Jury Instruction 100, no objection to leaving it. 

Jury Instruction 101, will be removed. No objection by either counsel.

Jury Instruction 1 Defendant, 2 counts is addressed.

Jury Instruction 980, Atty Schmidt  requests this, for reasons stated on the record. 
Exhibit #22 and #2 are referred to.
Atty Molepske objects for reasons stated on the record.  172 Wis 2nd 1,8  Hillsheim (sp) case is referred to, paragraph 7. State of WI vs. Travis Peterson 2009AP14, is referred to.  Atty Schmidt replies. Discussions continue.  
BY THE COURT:Court will allow and include the 980 entrampment defense language to be put in, will be put in before the jury decision instruction.

Jury Instruction 140, no objections.

Jury Instruction 145, no objections.

Jury Instruction 103, no objections.

Jury Instruction 170, no objections.

Jury Instruction confessions/admissions, no objections.

Jury Instruction 157, no objections.

Jury Instruction improper statement, no objections.

Jury Instruction 148, no objections.

Jury Instruction 150, no objections.

Jury Instruction recording played to the jury, will remove 158, no objections.

Jury Instruction weight of evidence, no objections.

Jury Instruction 195, no objections.

Jury Instruction 160 and 465 previously addressed, no objections.

Jury Instruction 484, no objections.

Court will have verdict forms available for parties to review before jurors return.

Jury Instruction 515, no objections.

State has no further requests for instructions.
Defense has no further requests for instructions.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, requests the Court to dismiss Count 1 and Count 2.

2:02 PM Court will return shortly, giving instructions to judicial assistant to complete before proceeding to motion.

2:05 PM Court is back on the record, appearances are as they were before.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court regarding the motion to dismiss each Count, for failure of proof, for reasons stated on the record. Atty Schmidt addresses Count 2 first.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court, responds to the motion, for the record.

Discussions continue regarding this motion among both counsel and the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Court will grant Defenses motion to dismiss Count 2.
Count 2 is dismissed.

Atty Schmidt moves to dismiss Count 1 as well, for reasons stated on the record.
948.055(1) is referred to.

Court questions Atty Schmidt for clarifications.
Atty Schmidt replies.
Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding Atty Schmidts motion to dismiss Count 1.

BY THE COURT:
Court will deny motion to dismiss Count 1.

2:44 PM Atty Molepske requests time to address a less included offense.
Court will give State a short amount of time to make the request.

2:45 PM Court is in recess.

3:06 PM Court is back in session, on the record.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court, will not be requesting a lesser offense.

Jury instructions are handed to the parties for review, Count 2 has been taken out.

3:13 PM Parties have had an opportunity to view the instructions.

Atty Molepske addresses Count 2.
Court proposes the language regarding Count 2. Parties do not object.

Both counsel find the instructions satisfactory.

3:15 PM Jurors enter the courtroom.

Court is on the record, parties are as they were, all 13 jurors enter the courtroom.

Court addresses the Jurors regarding Count 2.
Court reads the Jury Instructions to the Jurors, for the record.

3:33 PM Atty Molepske gives closing statements.
4:05 PM Atty Schmidt gives closing statements.
4:25 PM Atty Molepske gives rebuttle statements.

4:30 PM Court addresses the jurors, addresses the two verdict forms.
Verdict must be reached unanimously.

4:35 PM Clerk administers Oath of Officers to the Bailiffs.

Cour thanks this juror and excuses this juror.

4:36 PM Jurors have left the courtroom.
State has nothing to put on the record.
Atty Schmidt has nothing to put on the record.

4:37 PM Court is in recess until further notice. 

Atty Molepske addresses the Court. 

All exhibits are accounted for.

5:30 PM Court is back on the record.
Court received a note from the jury.
Court reads the note, requests two of the exhibits.

State has no objection.
Atty Schmidt reviews the exhibits, has no objection.

BY THE COURT:
Exhibit #1 and Exhibit # 2 may be sent back to the jury.

Atty Molepske went through all the emails in these exhibits.

Court will query the jury at about 6 pm.

5:36 PM Court is in recess.

6:04 PM Court is back in session.
Jury is still deliberating.
It is the Courts intention to bring the Jury in and have them come back in tomorrow morning.

Neither counsel object.

6:05 PM Jurors return to the courtroom.

Parties are the same as they were before the recess, before the jury deliberated.
All 12 jurors have returned to the courtroom.
Jurors have been deliberating diligently.

Court will adjourn the trial for the day and asks each juror to return 8:30 am tomorrow morning.  

6:06 PM Jury is excused until tomorrow at 8:30 am.

6:07 PM Jurors leave the courtroom.
Neither party has anything to put on the record.

Matter is adjourned till tomorrow at 8:30 am.

10:22 AM State had moved to amend the information, Court granted the amendment. State drafted a formal amendment, was provided to the Court this morning, a second amendment of the information, changing the date rage and date of the week.

Court informs Defendant of amended charges and penalties.
Defendant understands, wavies reading of the counts.

BY THE COURT:
Court believes the transcript is allowable to hand out to Jurors while audio tape is being played/presented. Court finds the transcript as an aid, accurate rendition of what was said. With proper foundation, transcript may be published and handed to the Jurors while audio tape is being played.  

Atty Molepske addresses the excel presentation.
Atty Schmidt replies, no objection to the use of the material

Defendant Ryan D. Cevan in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:34 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.
Hearing set for Defendant's Motion's.
Atty Schmidt makes statements regarding the Motion to Suppress; Atty Schmidt will be withdrawing his Motion to Suppress.
Atty Schmidt makes additional statments regarding Motions filed by the State.
Court makes statements regarding the Motions filed by the State; Atty Schmidt responds.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding incorrect dates on his paperwork.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding telephonic testimony by Dr Nelson and would oppose this and would ask that this witness appear in person.
Atty Molepske reviews statutes and makes statements.
Atty Schmidt does not wish to be heard on this issue.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding Jury Instructions; Court makes statements. 
Court will put together a proposed set if Jury Instructions and provide to all parties.
Atty Molepske makes additional statements regarding expert testimony.
Atty Schmidt will provide his expert witnesses to Atty Molepske by the end of the week; Court sets a deadline of September 9, 2015.

BY THE COURT:
Motion to Suppress filed by the Defendant is withdrawn/denied.
Motion by the State is granted.
Dr Nelson will need to appear in person.

8:45 a.m.  Court is in recess.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Notice, Affidavit and Answer Opposing Defendant's Motion to Suppress

Motion hearing at 09-02-2015 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 12-02-2015 08:30 am.

Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:54 a.m.  
Court notes earlier this morning the parties met in chambers with issues that came up at the last minute.  Court has received a motion to suppress evidence by the defense.  Defense counsel received from the DA some exculpatory evidence that the DA just received from an out of county investigator.  Atty Schmidt would like some time to review the evidence and asked for an adjournment. 
Parties agree with the recitation of the Court.  
Court was concerned that this information was just recently received.  Court grants the adjournment.  Court has set a motion date as well.  Any other motions to be filed by August 21st, 2015. 
Court addresses Atty Schmidt. 
Atty Schmidt will be discussing the adjournment with his client later today.  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:29 AM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Defendant does not appear.

Court scheduled this on a last minute motion by the State.
Atty Schmidt is not anticipating his client here today, believes Defendant did not get notice of today's hearing, did not talk to him.

State filed a motion to amend the charge, amend the information.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, opposes the motion.  

Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding the motion, for the record.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court regarding opposition of motion.

Court questions Defense.

Atty Schmidt replies.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants the State's motion to amend as to the Court does not find Defense is prejudicial even at this late date.

Discussions continue.

Court addresses the motion that the State filed on May 15th. 
Atty Schmidt is not prepared to address this motion.
Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding this motion.
Atty Schmidt does not recognize this document. Atty Molepske states that the document was sent to Defense on May 15th. Atty Schmidt has not reviewed it.
Atty Schmidt reviews document, replies.

Court would like to see the attorneys at 8:15 before the 8:30 trial if discussion needs to be held on this motion. 

Atty Molepske addresses the Court, filed a jury instruction.
Court will draft a proposed jury instruction and will be completed before trial for parties to review.

Parties discuss offers, there as not been a resolution at this time.
